Reasons? not to share: The time it takes to clean up and document for release
The possibility that your data may be used without citation

Reasons to share: Potential to encourage others to work on the problem
Encouraging sharing and having others share with you
Reasons? not to share: Time to verify privacy or other administrative data concerns

Reasons to share: The potential to set a standard for the field
Reasons? not to share: The potential loss of future publications using this data

Reasons to share: Improvement in the caliber of research

Reasons? not to share: Dealing with questions from users about the data

Reasons to share: Opportunity to get feedback on your work
Reasons? not to share: Technical limitations, ie. webspace platform space constraints
Whether there is intense competition in the topic
Whether you put in a large amount of work building the dataset

Reasons to share: To reproduce or to verify research
Reasons? not to share: Insufficient perceived reward, such as promotion or subsequent citation

Reasons to share: To make the results of publicly funded research available to the public
To enable others to ask new questions of extant data
Reasons? not to share: Concerns for priority, including control of results and sources

Reasons to share: To advance the state of research and innovation
